ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 2 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very practical approach.

Overall the course is very enlightening. It introduced a number of epidemiological concepts in occupational and environmental medicine using articles in the public health literature. My only suggestion for improvement would be for the instructors to share their slides after the lecture to help students reinforce their learning and for further study.
I liked the variety of guests who lectured. Some lectures were a little bit geared to the physicians in the room, but overall it was still helpful to learn.

The class is amazing! So engaging and interesting and made me really want to learn and read more about epidemiology and the many issues faced in env. and occ. medicine. The low workload on a week to week basis takes away some of the stress during class time of having to absorb every detail and allows for more space to think critically about how to best handle many of the issues, studies, and outbreaks discussed in the course.
Excellent, with focus on a spectrum of Occupational exposures and how to manage them. Very informative.

This course gives an excellent overview of the epidemiology of occupational and environmental illness. Through case histories and an understanding of the various methodological issues unique to the field.

I loved this class! It was honestly more of a seminar than a class, which is how grad school should be. I found this style to be more enjoyable and less stressful. Every week, we engagingly discussed relevant EHS topics per the syllabus. The only assignment throughout the semester was a final take-home exam.
Very good. Encouraged student participation and discussion.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Extremely knowledgeable and personable
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very thorough.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Excellent and knowledgeable instructor. Very approachable and makes the sessions fun and interactive.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very kind, very responsive, enjoyed his lectures.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  He's an awesome professor.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very friendly, has a great sense of humor, smart, knowledgeable.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Fantastic lecturer.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Very engaging and informative lectures. I appreciated the mixture of powerpoint lectures and discussion based lectures. Very receptive to student questions.
Instructor: Mark Bernard Russi  Excellent. Approachable. Student and learning oriented.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Extremely knowledgeable and personable
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very friendly and nice.

Instructor: Martin David Slade  Also a very knowledgeable instructor. Very experienced in real-life issues in occupational and environmental medicine. Brings a lot of practical information with regards to the field.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very helpful, loved having industry experience in the room, really enjoyed his lecture style.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  He's an awesome professor.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Very approachable, friendly, considerate. Creates a very comfortable environment in class.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Excellent job. Knows the material well and ask interesting questions.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Lectures were also very well organized and interesting. He is great to interact with in and out of the classroom.
Instructor: Martin David Slade  Excellent. Student and learning oriented.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course, would recommend.

I would recommend the course to any student looking for better understanding of the peculiar epidemiological issues involved in occupational and environmental medicine through critiquing case studies and research articles in the field. The classes are laid-back and interactive with lots of questions asked to the students. The workload is light, with class participation and a take home final constituting your course score grade.
Seminar-style course the allows you to understand a variety of case studies dealing with occupational safety and medicine. Very interesting and not difficult at all.

The class is amazing! So engaging and interesting and made me really want to learn and read more about epidemiology and the many issues faced in env. and occ. medicine. The low workload on a week to week basis takes away some of the stress during class time of having to absorb every detail and allows for more space to think critically about how to best handle many of the issues, studies, and outbreaks discussed in the course. Highly recommend!!!
Sure, great course.
I would recommend if you are interested in the health effects and diseases related to occupational and environmental exposures, how they have been studied, and you might approach studying them.
Would highly recommend
I would recommend.
